pineapple.name: Pineapple, raw
pineapple.insight: A tropical enzyme powerhouse delivering 131% DV of vitamin C plus bromelain for digestion and inflammation, with exceptional manganese for bone and metabolism.

balanced.insight: Outstanding vitamin C (131% DV) and manganese (65% DV) plus bromelain enzyme create exceptional nutritional value. Good fiber (2.3g) balances natural sugars.

heart_health.insight: Bromelain reduces inflammation and blood clotting risk, exceptional vitamin C supports arterial health, fiber aids cholesterol reduction, and zero saturated fat.
pros: Exceptional vitamin C for arterial walls

muscle_building.insight: Bromelain enzyme reduces muscle soreness and aids protein digestion. Minimal protein (0.9g) but vitamin C (78.9mg) supports collagen in muscle tissue.
pros: Vitamin C for muscle tissue repair

energy.insight: Natural sugars with good fiber (2.3g) provide sustained energy. B vitamins (thiamin, B6) support energy metabolism. Manganese aids carb metabolism.
cons: May cause brief energy dip if eaten alone

weight_management.insight: Only 83 calories per cup with good fiber (2.3g) creates solid satiety. Bromelain may aid protein digestion and metabolism. Volume satisfies cravings.

brain_focus.insight: Exceptional vitamin C (78.9mg) supports neurotransmitter synthesis. Manganese crucial for brain function. Bromelain may reduce neuroinflammation.

gut_health.insight: Bromelain enzyme aids protein digestion powerfully. Good fiber (2.3g) feeds beneficial bacteria. Anti-inflammatory properties soothe digestive tract.

blood_sugar.insight: Medium GI (66) but low glycemic load (6) from reasonable fiber (2.3g). Manganese supports glucose metabolism. Bromelain may improve insulin sensitivity.

bone_joint.insight: Exceptional manganese (1.5mg, 65% DV) critical for bone formation and cartilage. Bromelain reduces joint inflammation and swelling powerfully. Vitamin C aids collagen.

anti_inflammatory.insight: Bromelain is one of nature's most powerful anti-inflammatory enzymes, clinically proven to reduce inflammation. Exceptional vitamin C and polyphenols amplify benefits.

bioavailability.bromelain: Most concentrated in core; absorption enhanced when taken away from food for inflammation benefits

pairWith.reason: Protein balances sugar, probiotics complement bromelain for digestion
Bromelain aids protein digestion while adding satiety

pineapple.portionVisual: 1 cup chunks equals size of a baseball

tips.storage: Whole pineapple lasts 2-3 days at room temp, 5-7 days refrigerated; cut pieces 3-4 days in airtight container
tips.selection: Should smell sweet at base, leaves pull out easily when ripe, golden color, heavy for size
tips.preparation: Remove core for tenderness or eat it for maximum bromelain; grill slices to caramelize sugars and reduce acidity

peach.name: Peach, raw
peach.insight: A low-calorie, high-water fruit with exceptional antioxidants and good fiber, delivering skin-supporting vitamin A and unique polyphenols for metabolic health.

balanced.insight: Low calories (59) with good fiber (2.3g), decent potassium (285mg), and strong antioxidant profile (ORAC 1814). Well-balanced sugar-to-fiber ratio.

heart_health.insight: Polyphenols and anthocyanins protect cardiovascular health. Good potassium (285mg) with zero sodium supports blood pressure. Fiber aids cholesterol reduction.

muscle_building.insight: Low protein (1.4g) limits muscle-building value. Potassium (285mg) helps prevent cramps and supports muscle function during recovery.

energy.insight: Natural sugars with good fiber (2.3g) provide moderate sustained energy. High water content (89%) fights fatigue. Niacin supports energy metabolism.

weight_management.insight: Only 59 calories with excellent satiety from fiber (2.3g) and high water (89%). Sweet taste satisfies cravings without caloric impact. Very filling.
pros: Excellent satiety from fiber and water

brain_focus.insight: Polyphenols may protect against cognitive decline. Niacin supports neurotransmitter function. Antioxidants reduce brain oxidative stress.

gut_health.insight: Good fiber (2.3g) supports gut motility and feeds beneficial bacteria. Polyphenols benefit microbiome diversity. Gentle on digestion with high water content.
cons: Not as high in prebiotics as some fruits

blood_sugar.insight: Low GI (42) and low glycemic load (5) make this excellent for blood sugar control. Good fiber (2.3g) slows sugar absorption. Polyphenols may improve insulin sensitivity.

bone_joint.insight: Vitamin K (3.9mcg) supports bone health. Polyphenols and antioxidants reduce joint inflammation. Vitamin C aids collagen synthesis.

anti_inflammatory.insight: Exceptional ORAC score (1814) with polyphenols, anthocyanins, and chlorogenic acid deliver powerful anti-inflammatory benefits. Vitamin E provides additional antioxidant support.

bioavailability.vitaminA: Beta-carotene absorption enhanced with small amount of fat
bioavailability.polyphenols: Better absorbed from ripe peaches; skin contains concentrated antioxidants

pairWith.reason: Protein balances sugar and creates satisfying snack
Healthy fats enhance nutrient absorption and add satiety

avoidWith.reason: May cause oral allergy syndrome in birch pollen-sensitive individuals

peach.portionVisual: 1 medium peach fits in palm of hand

tips.storage: Ripen at room temp until fragrant, then refrigerate for up to 5 days; don't refrigerate unripe peaches
tips.selection: Should yield slightly to gentle pressure, smell fragrant, avoid green or very hard peaches
tips.preparation: Eat skin for maximum fiber and antioxidants; grill or roast to concentrate flavors; freeze slices for smoothies

pear.name: Pear, raw
pear.insight: The ultimate fiber champion delivering 22% DV per fruit with exceptional satiety, plus unique pectin for cholesterol reduction and gut health.

balanced.insight: Exceptional fiber (5.5g, 22% DV) creates outstanding satiety and nutritional balance. Strong antioxidant profile (ORAC 2941) with good potassium (206mg).

heart_health.insight: Exceptional soluble fiber (pectin) powerfully lowers LDL cholesterol. Potassium supports blood pressure. Polyphenols protect arterial health. Zero saturated fat.

muscle_building.insight: Very low protein (0.6g) offers minimal muscle-building value. Potassium (206mg) helps prevent cramps. Good for lean gains due to low calories.

energy.insight: Exceptional fiber (5.5g) provides sustained energy release from natural sugars. High water (84%) fights fatigue. Steady glucose without spikes.

weight_management.insight: Exceptional satiety from outstanding fiber (5.5g) combined with high water (84%) creates powerful fullness. Only 101 calories. Pectin reduces appetite hormones.

brain_focus.insight: Polyphenols and antioxidants protect against cognitive decline. Fiber stabilizes blood sugar for steady focus. Copper supports neurotransmitter function.

gut_health.insight: Exceptional fiber (5.5g) with high pectin content powerfully feeds beneficial bacteria and improves gut motility. One of the best fruits for digestive health.
cons: May cause gas in sensitive individuals

blood_sugar.insight: Very low GI (38) and low glycemic load (4) from exceptional fiber (5.5g). Pectin dramatically slows sugar absorption. Excellent for diabetes management.

bone_joint.insight: Vitamin K (7.8mcg) supports bone mineralization. Strong antioxidants reduce joint inflammation. Copper aids collagen formation.

anti_inflammatory.insight: Outstanding ORAC score (2941) with quercetin, catechins, and chlorogenic acid deliver powerful anti-inflammatory benefits. Fiber reduces systemic inflammation.

bioavailability.fiber: Pectin in skin and flesh; eat with skin for maximum benefit
bioavailability.polyphenols: Concentrated in skin; better absorbed from ripe pears

pairWith.reason: Classic pairing adds protein and fat for balanced snack
Adds omega-3, protein, and enhances polyphenol absorption
Protein and healthy fats create complete, satisfying snack

avoidWith.reason: May cause oral allergy syndrome in birch pollen-sensitive individuals

pear.portionVisual: 1 medium pear fits in palm, about size of a light bulb

tips.storage: Ripen at room temp until neck yields to gentle pressure, then refrigerate for up to 5 days
tips.selection: Press gently near stem—should yield slightly when ripe; avoid bruised or very soft pears
tips.preparation: Eat skin for maximum fiber and antioxidants; ripen faster by placing in paper bag with banana

raspberry.name: Raspberries, raw
raspberry.insight: The ultimate superfruit combining exceptional fiber (8g, 32% DV), extraordinarily low sugar, and the highest antioxidant power with unique ellagic acid for cancer prevention.

balanced.insight: Exceptional fiber (8g, 32% DV) with remarkably low sugar (5.4g) creates perfect nutritional balance. Outstanding antioxidants (ORAC 5065) and micronutrients.

heart_health.insight: Exceptional fiber lowers cholesterol, ellagic acid and anthocyanins protect cardiovascular system powerfully. Polyphenols improve blood flow. Zero saturated fat.

muscle_building.insight: Low protein (1.5g) but exceptional antioxidants (ORAC 5065) reduce exercise-induced oxidative stress. Vitamin C (32mg) supports collagen in muscle tissue.

energy.insight: Exceptional fiber (8g) provides sustained energy without blood sugar spikes. Very low sugar (5.4g) prevents crashes. Manganese supports energy metabolism.
cons: Lower energy density than some fruits

weight_management.insight: Only 64 calories with exceptional fiber (8g) and very low sugar (5.4g) create outstanding satiety. One of the best fruits for weight loss. High volume-to-calorie ratio.

brain_focus.insight: Exceptional polyphenols and anthocyanins powerfully protect against cognitive decline. Vitamin C supports neurotransmitters. Fiber stabilizes blood sugar for focus.

gut_health.insight: Exceptional fiber (8g, 32% DV) powerfully feeds beneficial bacteria. Ellagic acid and polyphenols improve microbiome diversity. Anti-inflammatory for gut lining.

blood_sugar.insight: Very low GI (25) and glycemic load (2) with exceptional fiber (8g) and very low sugar (5.4g). Absolutely excellent for diabetes management.

bone_joint.insight: Exceptional anti-inflammatory properties (index -3.8) powerfully protect joints. Vitamin K, manganese, and magnesium support bone health. Vitamin C aids collagen.
pros: Vitamin K and manganese for bones

anti_inflammatory.insight: Exceptional ORAC score (5065) with ellagic acid, anthocyanins, and quercetin deliver extraordinary anti-inflammatory power. One of nature's most potent anti-inflammatory foods.

bioavailability.ellagicAcid: Better absorbed from fresh berries; enhanced with vitamin C
bioavailability.anthocyanins: Fat enhances absorption; pair with yogurt or nuts

pairWith.reason: Protein balances carbs, probiotics complement fiber, fat enhances polyphenol absorption
Adds omega-3 and creates complete superfood combination
Amplifies antioxidant benefits and improves absorption

avoidWith.reason: Contains oxalates which may contribute to kidney stones in susceptible individuals

raspberry.portionVisual: 1 cup equals size of a baseball or 1 closed fist

tips.storage: Refrigerate unwashed in shallow container for 2-3 days; freeze for up to 12 months
tips.selection: Choose plump, firm berries with bright color; avoid mushy, moldy, or leaking berries
tips.preparation: Rinse just before eating to prevent mold; freeze on tray before bagging for smoothies; eat whole for maximum fiber
